definition: extortion by taking advantage of sb's weakness
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge
thick pole/bar/rod/thick line/to mark with a thick line/to sharpen (knife)/(old) coffin-bearing pole

sentences.english: On the other hand, you might get ripped off since you don't know the seller .
sentences.chinese: 在另一方面，你可能會被敲竹槓，因爲你不知道賣方。

sentences.english: I got ripped off for paying extra money to that vendor.
sentences.chinese: 我被敲竹槓了，多付了那個小販的錢。

sentences.english: He did her down over selling the house.
It's a vile attempt to extort money, " said Mr. Pickwick."
sentences.chinese: “這是下流的敲竹槓的企圖，”匹克威克先生說。

sentences.english: In some tourist cities, tourists are often ripped off.
sentences.chinese: 在一些旅遊城市，遊客們經常被敲竹槓。

sentences.english: A sweet and pretty bamboo shoots girl , the bamboo is exactly knocked for itself.
sentences.chinese: 竹筍姑娘的嬌美，恰恰是被“敲竹槓”的緣由。
